p: The tubular epithelial cells of the kidneys may be, like the pulmonary pneumocytes, the target of the virus. The result is acute renal failure, which is not, as initially thought, functional in relation to hydro electrolytic disorders, but organic with necrosis of the tubular cells, often irreversible, and thus progressing to chronic renal failure. This will result in the need to resort to haemodialysis for an indefinite period of time.
